Bond¶

This describes the bond module.

class bond.Bond(maturitydate, couponrate, frequency_per_anno, price=100.0, startdate=datetime.datetime(2012, 11, 12, 23, 30, 36, 545126))¶

This class generates a bond from some basic economic information and generates the corresponding cashflow. If no price is given the bond is assumed to be 100. Offset and coupon dates are a bit rudimentary and need to be improved. e.g. Daycount conventions, rolling, etc.

Example:

>>> startdate = dt.datetime(2012, 1, 1)
>>> maturitydate = dt.datetime(2015, 1, 1)
>>> bd = Bond(startdate = startdate, maturitydate = maturitydate, couponrate = 0.05, frequency_per_anno  = 2)
>>> bd.price
100.0
>>> bd.couponrate
0.05
>>> bd.frequency
2
>>> bd.startdate
datetime.datetime(2012, 1, 2, 0, 0)
>>> bd.maturitydate
datetime.datetime(2015, 1, 2, 0, 0)
>>> bd
